fields.description:
h1. Current Scenario
* Currently instances are geographically located nearest to users' location, identified by the incoming traffic. This affects the whole instance, so if an instance has users from the US and from Europe, and the majority of the traffic comes from the US this instance will most likely be hosted in the US. 
* This can create longer loading times for users far from the instance location, due to latency.

h1. Proposed Suggestion
* Allow certain parts of an instance to be geographically located on other areas, to decrease loading times.
* For example: locate certain Confluence spaces in Europe, while other spaces continue to be hosted in the US. This way admins could set specific spaces for Europe, decreasing latency and loading times.
fields.summary: Allow certain parts of an instance to be geographically located on other countries / areas

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 5 March 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,
  
 While it's not the direct focus of this feature request, we are aware that many of you are following this ticket because you have a requirement for data residency, which is currently only available in the Enterprise plan. I'm excited to announce that our Standard and Premium plans for Jira and Confluence cloud will include data residency later this year. We've shared more details on CLOUD-11100. You can read the update there, or check out our landing page to [learn more and sign up to receive an email update when it's available here|https://www.atlassian.com/software/data-residency].
  
 We do plan to offer the Enterprise plan to customers with fewer than 1000 users in the future; however we are not ready to share an availability date at this time.
  
 Regards,
 Dave Meyer
 Senior Group Product Manager
{panel}
Currently the cloud Enterprise plans for Jira Software and Confluence require a minimum of 1,000 users. This creates a major obstacle for customers who require data residency (currently available with an EU and US realm in the Enterprise plan) in order to adopt Atlassian's cloud products.

We will use this ticket, in conjunction with [our public roadmap|http://www.atlassian.com/roadmap/cloud], to communicate updates about the availability of Enterprise at smaller user tiers.
fields.summary: Offer Atlassian cloud Enterprise plan subscriptions for user tiers below 1,000

fields.description:
It would be more convenient if we have more options for workflow conditions such that, only one transition is visible for users when a condition is met, instead of showing all the transitions from the respective status. 

For example: if a ticket is being closed after the due date, there should only be one transition visible: "close late". If it's resolved in time, only the transition "close in time" should be visible.
Hence as per the condition, user should only see one transition "close late" or "close in time" depending on the value of the current date.
fields.summary: Provide ability to build the workflow condition with more options or using scripts.

fields.description:
Ukraine has a law on the storage of personal data, therefore, most companies, especially large ones, are obliged to store data on the territory of the country. At the same time, there are many companies that do not need such a large number of users that the data center version offers.

The only way with new licensing rules is to add the ability to host cloud products in Ukraine and confirm this with the state
fields.summary: Please, add Ukraine as Region of Cloud installation

fields.description:
Hi! 

we have some regulation for our country :( 

Federal Law of 27 July 2006 N 152-FZ ON PERSONAL DATA

[https://pd.rkn.gov.ru/authority/p146/p164/]

 

I will be happy if you provide an cloud installations for cloud. it helps more and more companies to go cloud.

 

Cheers,

Gonchik Tsymzhitov
fields.summary: Please, add Russia as Region of Cloud installation

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, the only manner we have to upload files on our Cloud products (JIRA and Confluence) is via UI, so when the subject is about migration, this process can take some time to be completed, as it is very manual.

h3. Suggestion
* Add a supported REST API on JIRA and Confluence to allow users to upload files via a script, in order to let this procedure more dynamic.
fields.summary: Add a REST API endpoint to support upload of attachments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Navigating to Confluence or Jira pages return 409 error messages


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Open developers tools 
# Navigate to the confluence

h3. Expected Results

It should not return 409.

h3. Actual Results

It returns the following errors.

409 response - https://<instanename>.atlassian.net/gateway/api/engage-targeting/api/v2/user/8e804ec9-0769-4140-9585-49d0ee81469b/messages/confluence-nav3-home-tour/start

409 response - https://<instanename>.atlassian.net/gateway/api/engage-targeting/api/v2/user/8e804ec9-0769-4140-9585-49d0ee81469b/messages/EXT-167/start

403 response - https://<instanename>.atlassian.net/gateway/api/join-site-service/site/8e804ec9-0769-4140-9585-49d0ee81469b/domainRestrictedSignupPromotion


h3. Workaround

No workaround. These can be safely ignored as per the Engineering team.
fields.summary: Navigating to Confluence or Jira pages return 409 error messages in Developers tools

fields.description:
{panel:title=(i) Implementation of New Features Policy| borderStyle=| borderColor=| titleBGColor=#e0efff| bgColor=}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].
{panel}

h3. Problem Definition

There is no standardized way of incident management for marketplace apps. It's hard for the app users to know when any incident occurs.

h3. Suggested Solution

Atlassian to provide a service for the app vendors to inform the latest status so that the app users can know an ongoing incident and scheduled maintenance, etc.

h3. Workaround

None. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Standardized way of incident reporting for the marketplace apps

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Basic user present in the administrator group is getting an error, accessing the App requests, but if being a site-admin impersonate the basic user, is not seeing any error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Basic User added in administrator group access the *App requests* section
 # Getting error: "We ran into a little trouble. It might be just a hiccup. Try again"
# When site-admin impersonate the basic user, no error is getting displayed.

h3. Expected Results
Basic User present in the administrator group should be able to access the *App requests* section

h3. Actual Results
Basic User present in administrator group getting an error while accessing the *App requests* section

h3. Workaround
Impersonation works.
fields.summary: Basic user present in administrator group is getting error, accessing the App requests
Ability to specify the user(s) that will receive Access Request notifications

h3. Expected Results
h3. Actual Results
{noformat}

Non available

fields.description:
h3. Current 
At the moment it is not possible to add/remove the shortcuts that are displayed for managed accounts at https://start.atlassian.com.

h3. Suggestion
Add the possibility for org admins being able to customize the shortcuts at https://start.atlassian.com.
fields.summary: As an org admin I'd like to customize the buttons at start.atlassian.com

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, Opsgenie and Statuspage are billed separately from other products, but it is possible to manage its users from the Site Administration.

Usually, this product comes with the toggle button "_New users have access to this product_" enabled by default. As many users we keep adding to our Confluence/JIRA subscriptions, if we are not aware that Opsgenie and Statuspage are also granting these users with access, our license seats keep being consumed. 

When we reach the Opsgenie/Statuspage licenses (that are usually less than the other products), the Site Administration throws up a generic error message saying our licenses have been reached.

h3. Suggestion
Include which is the product that reached the valid licenses, so the users know what to do.
fields.summary: Improve error messages when Opsgenie/Statuspage reaches the total of licenses

fields.description: Atlassian could allow app editors to propose their apps for free in the marketplace for the Free plan sites.
fields.summary: Free apps for Free plans

fields.description:
Currently, the invitation links sent for users on Cloud are valid for 30 days and even though you have the option to re-send the invite, it's not possible to see when the last invitation was sent.

 !image-2020-08-26-09-45-10-570.png|thumbnail! 

As a site-admin, it would be best if we could see when the invitation was sent to new users.
fields.summary: Provide a date of invitation sent

fields.description:
h3. Issue : 
Translation for keyword when a subscription is canceled does not work. When trying to cancel subscription, it is requested to indicate a keyword in the text box, this key word is CANCEL in English, but it is translated to the language the user has set in their profile. will not cancel the subscription and we have to type in English as "CANCEL".

h3. Steps to replicate
# Set your profile language to any other than English
# Go to your organization administration page.
# Attempt to remove a subscription.
# A message will ask you to indicate a word to confirm the cancellation,  

h3. Expected Result
The word is indicated and more options are shown.

h3. Actual Result
The word is indicated and nothing happens

Dutch
!image-2020-08-26-18-05-33-218.png|width=265,height=381!
As per the description, when typing ANNULEREN will not cancel subscription 

French
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
The word ANNULER doesn't work.

h3. Workaround
Indicate the word CANCEL (in English) to continue with the procedure.
fields.summary: Translation for keyword when a subscription is canceled does not work.

Currently, the invitation links sent for users on Cloud are valid for 30 days.

As an organization, it would be great to adjust this based on internal compliance policies.

fields.description:
{panel:title=(i) Bug Fix Policy| borderStyle=| borderColor=| titleBGColor=#e0efff| bgColor=}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for the fix to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes bugfixes.
You can learn more by reading [Atlassian Cloud Bug Fixing Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-cloud-bug-fixing-policy-206865884.html].
{panel}

h3. Issue Summary

One org-admin reported that some of their managed users face an infinite loading loop animation after logging in.
 !Screen Shot 2020-08-13 at 11.08.28.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login as the affected account at https://id.atlassian.com/login?continue=https%3A%2F%2Fstart.atlassian.com%2F
 ** Detailed condition is not known
 # Notice the circle roading animation continues rolling endlessly
 # Login action per se successes so they can browse their site such as example.atlassian.net

h3. Expected Results

Any user can browse the content of start.atlassian.com after login.

h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the browser console:

{code:none}
index.js:3721 error when fetching activities from worklens TypeError: Cannot read property 'accountId' of null
    at activityStore.ts:21
    at Array.map (<anonymous>)
    at activityStore.ts:20
    at Array.map (<anonymous>)
    at an (activityStore.ts:11)
    at activityStore.ts:53
    at v (runtime.js:62)
    at Generator._invoke (runtime.js:288)
    at Generator.forEach.e.<computed> [as next] (runtime.js:114)
    at rn (main.ed28b480da9572f54259.js:146)
    at a (main.ed28b480da9572f54259.js:146)
{code}


h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.

Consider letting the affected managed users directly access the site URL so that they will be redirected to the site once they log in.
fields.summary: Infinite loading loop in start.atlassian.com

fields.description:

 * User is added
 * User is deleted
 * group is created
 * group is deleted
 * user added to the group
fields.summary: Notification to trigger for org related changes

fields.summary: Add Traditional Chinese Support

fields.description:
The 'Give Feedback' button sends feedback to Atlassian. However, end-users can submit feedback thinking it goes to their admins, not to Atlassian. 
Customers would prefer for end-users to contact their admins directly if there's an issue so they can reach our to Atlassian if needed.
fields.summary: Allow admins to disable the Give Feedback button

fields.description: It would be nice if we could see upcoming maintenance in a calendar view in StatusPage.
fields.summary: Add Calendar View for upcoming maintenance in Status Page

fields.description:
Current Jira and Confluence Cloud users cannot opt-out analytics as mentioned in this [article|[https://blog.seibert-media.com/2017/07/03/want-better-data-security-and-privacy-disable-atlassian-analytics/]]

Please allow  Jira and Confluence cloud users to opt-out of analytics.

With new GDPR these things are important to enhance end user privacy.
fields.summary: Allow Jira and Confluence Cloud users to opt-out of analytics.

fields.description: Currently our status page (status.taskrabbit.com) has *ajs_anonymous_id* and *ajs_group_id* cookies which are unessential so under GDPR users need to be able to opt-out of both. Adding that functionality would be really helpful and would ensure that we are compliant with GDPR.
fields.summary: Allow ajs_anonymous_id and ajs_group_id cookies to be removed from status pages

fields.description:
a proposal similar to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-70841?_ga=2.137173494.799348461.1595834418-2105148685.1590506378

Huge request to introduce the function of limiting clients for service desk
fields.summary: function of limiting clients for service desk

fields.description:
Many Atlassian customers now use our Jira/Confluence/Jira Service Desk Cloud platform for 24x7, mission critical operations and even minor maintenance windows have a significant impact on their experience. In order to provide a Cloud service for this customer base we need to:
# Minimise the number of planned downtime changes that need to occur
# Give significant notice to the customer if any downtime is to occur
# Perform the planned downtime during a convenient time for the customer either through allowing them to choose, or performing it on the weekend during the evening according to the customer's timezone.
fields.summary: Zero maintenance downtime for Jira and Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
When creating Test Notes in the 'New' view I seem to be limited to a small window off to the side of the page. I would like to be able to add this item to the main page.

It would be good if we could add things to the Activities list alongside Comments, History etc. 

The test notes often include screen shots of the GUI in a particular state and using these in the restricted side bar space is a nightmare, for both our developers who have to put them there and our testers who have to try to read them.
fields.summary: Make it possible to add Side Bar Items as part of the main view.

fields.description: Jira Cloud does not have Cloud-to-Cloud (C2C) backup and restore. Current backup manager saves zipped XML file to local machine backup is run on. Jira Knowledgbase suggests NOT using backup manager as restore file could be corrupted if it is generated during a data update by user. Company called Skyvia performs C2C to Azure cloud. Why can't that be built-in to Jira Cloud?
fields.summary: C2C Backup/Restore

fields.description: *I will design QR code and logo*
fields.summary: DURGA SHREE

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users are unable to generate instance backups / space exports (Due to zipper failure)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access any space and click on *Space Settings* > *Content Tools* > *Export* > *XML* > *Full Export* (Or Custom Export will do);

h3. Expected Results
 * Content to be exported into a zip file;

h3. Actual Results
 * No file is generated, and progress is stuck when creating the final Zip file.
 (!) Note: Any kind of export that generates a zip file will hang during backup, with the Exporter message displaying "Creating the zip file".

!Screen Shot 2020-07-02 at 14.40.01.png|width=548,height=233!
h3. Workaround
 * Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to Generate Backups or space exports

fields.description: As an admin, I should have an option to perform a bulk delete or clean up of the requests in Access settings page under Administration tab.
fields.summary: Ability to perform a bulk delete clean up of the requests in Access settings page.

fields.description:
When i want to change the properties or work on document that is attached to a page, the buttons to do so are below the version history tabel. So it requires to scroll down the list to get to these buttons.

Can you relocate the buttons 'view' 'properties' ' edit file' 'delete' above the list of the version history?

It will improve the users experience.

Txs
fields.summary: Attachments: move buttons 'view' 'properties' ' edit file' 'delete'

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* Currently the list of IP addresses/ranges published on https://ip-ranges.atlassian.com/ is too large to fit in an AWS security group

h3. Suggested Solution
* Remove unnecessary entries(if any)
* Provide specific ranges to customers so they can configure AWS security groups

h3. Why this is important
 * It's not uncommon for customers to want to run our products in AWS

h3. Workaround 
* No known workarounds
fields.summary: Customers are unable to configure AWS security groups

fields.description: Corporate Atlassian Cloud users need the ability to securely authenticate partners/consultants who collaborate on projects.  2FA via Access is currently enforceable only via our owned domain, meaning we can only be assured of the identity of our own employees, but must hope for the best if we need to invite in a consultant or partner (or customer).  2FA should be enforceable across all who need access to projects... not just the employees of the business... and, as such should be enforceable project by project as well as at the site level.
fields.summary: We need to assure 2FA of all who require access to our projects - not just our employees within our owned domain..

fields.description:
Some users need to make reports from information that is on the administration page (admin.atlassian.com), only Site, and Org admins can access the administration page and those 2 admins have all the configuration privileges to the site´s administration page.

It would be useful if something like read-only permission can be applied to the administration page.
fields.summary: Administration page read-only permission

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Many customers are required to provide metrics for their systems for various industry certifications such as ISO, CMMI, and CMMC. Currently, Jira Cloud or Confluence Cloud sites do not offer any monitoring or reporting functionality related to site availability or other such metrics at the site level.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide reporting functionality regarding availability and other such metrics at the site level.
fields.summary: Site Availability Reporting

fields.description:
There is controlled access that allow only users who have a Confluence account to see a Confluence Cloud Space and the other option is full anonymous access who provides access to anyone in the Internet.

I know whitelist is in progress to restrict access to a particular IP, but it would be great if there was a middle ground that allowed anyone with a *@companydomain.com email address (possibly authenticated by O365 or any other third party Identity provider) to have read only access to a Confluence Space without the need of a full license.  

Thank you
fields.summary: Allow all customer employees to have read access to a Confluence Space (Cloud)

fields.description:
Summary:
 * Currently, when a user navigates to a product where the user does not have the application access. They will be seeing the error message stating "Your access is denied, contact the administrator."

Suggestion:
 * Ability to include a contact form and customization option.
fields.summary: Ability to customize the Application Access error message

fields.description:
h4. Hi,
h4. Under *Administration > Site Settings > Site Access > Access Requests* the following information is displayed:
h4. Your settings
 * *Site admins and trusted users* can invite anyone to any product(s).

Note: Existing users can always request access to products, from an admin, both for themselves and for new users.

As an Administrator it would be extremely useful to be able to disable the option for existing users to request access to products for new users. 

I know that you will say that under *User Invites* there's an option to enable/disable existing users from sending invites to anyone. But that setting does not work.

Many of our users keep on generating these invites via Slack (through a Jira add-on) sending invites to existing users but the invite is actually sent to a different email address (Slack's username in this case) which ends up creating an additional Atlassian account. This is becoming a nightmare to manage.

Simply stop allowing existing users (without Admin privileges) to send invites out!

 

Kind Regards,

Emiliyan
fields.summary: Site Access

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The link created on {color:#00875A}{{admin.atlassian.com/s/<INSTANCE_ID>/signup}}{color} is throwing a *This invite is invalid* error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access the admin page for your instance ({{admin.atlassian.com/s/<INSTANCE_ID>/signup}})
# Select *Invite Links*
# Generate and copy a new link
# Try to use the link to login with a new account

h3. Expected Results
It should be possible to signup to the instance using that link

h3. Actual Results
It shows a *This invite is invalid* error page:
| !Screen Shot 2020-05-20 at 20.34.38.png|thumbnail! |


h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Invite Links are not working

fields.description:
{panel:title=Implementation of New Features Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
 You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].

If *Administration Access* is empty on *Administration* page *Jira* link doesn't work

Access to the cloud site
h3. Actual Results

An error from the browser:

Sometimes is necessary to revoke all the product invites and disable the access requests, currently, even though all site access options are disabled users are still able to request access, it would be useful to have the option to disable completely those access requests.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

fields.description: hhhh

fields.description:
As an Atlassian Cloud admins (Jira / Jira Service Desk / Confluence), we do not have any monitoring tools.

We need a proper System Overview page for Admins.

Match metrics with size profiles:
 * Number of projects
 * Issues
 * Permission schemes
 * Custom fields
 * Custom fields schemes
 * Screen
 * Screens schemes
 * Workflows (Post functions, 
 * Groups
 * Users
 * Organizations
 * Issue Security schemes
 * Issue types
 * Automation rules
 * Filters
 * Apps
 * Statuses
 * Comments 
 * Audit logs
 * Email audit logs

 
Attachments size 
 * by Space in Confluence
 * by Project in Jira
 * by Project in Jira Service Desk (JSD)
 * the list of all attachments (order by size)
 * the list of the *largest attachments* in Jira/Confluence/JSD

Statistics Http - 1 week/month

!https://marketplace-cdn.atlassian.com/files/images/net.bull.javamelody/33eed5dc-26cf-438e-be81-3bee767f100c.png!

 Http sessions 

!https://marketplace-cdn.atlassian.com/files/images/net.bull.javamelody/7db4c09c-1287-47c5-9463-ebe4f542c9e2.png!
Match metrics with size profiles:

!https://attachments.office.net/owa/pososhenko%40imaginesoftware.com/service.svc/s/GetAttachmentThumbnail?id=AAMkADBiYzdjMmVjLWI1ZjAtNGE5Zi1hN2FjLWZmNThiMTBiNTQ4OABGAAAAAAAGkSUHrEOPQJhnbK2cCxIEBwCHpiigH7RfRI%2FJVQ4cMj13AAAAAAEJAACHpiigH7RfRI%2FJVQ4cMj13AACZRi0NAAABEgAQALYJXWwkxy1GuEaf0Uv5AXw%3D&thumbnailType=2&owa=outlook.office.com&scriptVer=2020031603.22&X-OWA-CANARY=OQkdPUtEv0ObHkxo53XT3HCAebGc0dcYKniVd73aZQtxy9lO81BdNYHPR0ajCvvwfYIOFhOwEvM.&token=eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiIsImtpZCI6IjU2MzU4ODUyMzRCOTI1MkRERTAwNTc2NkQ5RDlGMjc2NTY1RjYzRTIiLCJ4NXQiOiJWaldJVWpTNUpTM2VBRmRtMmRueWRsWmZZLUkiLCJ0eXAiOiJKV1QifQ..DSq5457KLCu3eAKgFM9TbDTthq35zoebBwYt4pOnzyIrOhtGL05NudV2kuIXKeulnfwhHHk3rljCh5_h9j-Oh1nZRQqZ-CWpvE49mtNLUAn684N3JXACrhdPSLaHDqKrGdgEUhn12WHm1Mg5w4z4KkbJq9_sTrO3wxjOMoNsZnbFUYLcbGFa3SjbzaN7BjCaWOCm6XDWu8QDCNXzoBjrnPHFelclrbzy6hJIz0HoywudacS-kVTjP2MoZ7OH-hx7WgjGoHKr9M53TnPhgfHxP-1VL0WYdDV83fCTmyXMgLMlUn90DTI0qdjjH0EB20s4aoK9s5Yl64rx9gWoZ0owaQ&animation=true!

Best wishes,

Anna.
fields.summary: Monitoring Section for Admins

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update - July 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#cccccc|titleBGColor=#3572b0}
As announced at the last Atlassian Summit in April 2019, we have now expanded the global cloud footprint of the Atlassian Cloud to the following geographical regions:
 * EU (Frankfurt, Dublin - announced in May 2017)
 * APAC (Sydney, Singapore)
 * US (east, west)

New customers signing up to Jira and Confluence Cloud will be automatically provisioned into to the region closest to the customer. As usage patterns for that customer change, we will automatically move customer data to their region of best fit, to optimise overall product performance. From [this blog:|https://www.atlassian.com/blog/platform/reach-for-the-cloud]
{quote}We’ve also improved the performance of our cloud products by doubling the number of AWS regions we support around the world. We started with the US (East and West Coast) and Dublin, then quickly expanded to include Sydney and Singapore. Most recently, we launched an AWS region in Frankfurt to improve performance for our European customers. Not only does this reduce latency and improve performance for our customers in these regions, but it also will soon enable us to offer a choice of data locality for our customers.
{quote}
For more details please see:
 - [https://www.atlassian.com/blog/platform/reach-for-the-cloud]
 - [https://www.atlassian.com/trust/infrastructure]

With this update, we'll be closing this ticket as Resolved. We understand that certain customers will have more specific requests for regions not explicitly covered above, and we will track those requests under separate tickets.

Cheers
Nuwan
Atlassian Product Management{panel}

{panel:title=Status Update - June 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#cccccc|titleBGColor=#3572b0}
As announced at the last Atlassian Summit, a first European data-center (located in Ireland) is now available.

You can Sign-up for our public beta offering and be one of the first customers to have their data hosted in Europe by going to: [https://www.atlassian.com/trust/infrastructure]
{quote}Atlassian cloud infrastructure expands to Europe
 Today, more than 75% of new Atlassian customers start with one of our cloud products, which means our cloud infrastructure must be up to the task. We are happy to announce that our cloud hosting infrastructure is going global, starting with the launch of a new European region in Ireland. After migration to this new infrastructure, our European cloud customers will experience improved performance and reduced latency.
 We know data privacy, security, and compliance are extremely important to our customers, and we are investing heavily in all of these areas. To reinforce this effort, we’ve made a foundational change in our cloud platform over the last year and are now using AWS to host our services. This enables us to offer an increased variety of cloud deployment regions, with strong performance and local failover options.
 But this is just a start. We’ll continue to add new cloud hosting regions around the world. If you are an existing JIRA and Confluence cloud customer and you are interested in migrating your data to Europe, you can [sign-up today|https://www.atlassian.com/trust/infrastructure].
{quote}
For more details please see:
 - [https://www.atlassian.com/blog/announcements/a-defining-moment-for-global-teamwork]
 - [https://www.atlassian.com/trust/infrastructure]
 - [http://www.computerworlduk.com/cloud-computing/atlassian-launches-first-data-centre-in-europe-as-part-of-global-expansion-3658427/]{panel}
 
h3.  Original description:

Various EU, Russia and AU customers have expressed interest in the availability of Atlassian OnDemand instances hosted outside of the US. The main issue with the US hosted services is

1) Network speed to/from locations across the pond. 
 2) Blocked content by China and Russia's national firewall

This ticket is simply to help gauge the overall interest.
fields.summary: Consider hosting services inside the UK

fields.description:
For most of our systems, we don't allow users to change passwords more than 2 times per day.

The premise is if a user has a favorite password (for example "lamepassword") and rules prevent the user from repeating the last 5 passwords, then the user could just change the password repeatedly ("lamepassword1", "lamepassword2", "lamepassword3", etc.) until they could use their favorite password again.

By limiting the number of times per day that a user could change their password, we can discourage (not elliminate) the recycling of passwords.
fields.summary: new option to prevent more than 2 password changes per days

fields.description:
As an Atlassian Cloud admin, I use Jira, Jira Service Desk and Confluence and receive StatusPage (status.atlassian.com) alerts.

At this time, there is no way to receive updates only when my own instance is affected.
I'd like to be able to limit alerts from the status page (status.atlassian.com) so I only get them when my instance is affected.
fields.summary: Receive StatusPage alerts only when own instance is affected

fields.description: test description
fields.summary: test

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customer not able to merge two instances.

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to view merge two instances.

h3. Why this is important
Customers having multiple instaces would like to merge instance to work on issues on a single platform.
fields.summary: Ability to merge two instances.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unable to set the Notification settings for each task in Jira mobile

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure the notification for each task in the project
 # There are no proper instruction or guide on how to configure this. 

h3. Expected Results
 # The user able to control on which notification they should be receiving in mobile apps

h3. Actual Results
# Its not working as expecting


h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

 !image-2020-02-19-16-07-03-890.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2020-02-19-16-07-19-927.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2020-02-19-16-07-31-362.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Notification settings for each task is not working Jira mobile app

fields.description:
When I try to connect  a knowledge base in JIRA project settings, I am prompted to start a free trial for Confluence Knowledge Base. 

However, I want to connect with my existing Confluence Knowledge Base for Server. If there is already an application link between the two, can the KB also be linked?

I'm unable to use Confluence Server because of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CLOUD-6999 which is pending since 2011!

See also: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Service-Desk-questions/Connect-Jira-Service-Desk-to-Confluence-Knowledge-Base-Server/qaq-p/1300467
fields.summary: Connect Jira Service Desk to Confluence Knowledge Base (Server)

fields.description:
Hello

First of all, I’m not sure where to post this, it concern iOS Jira and Confluence apps, which works only with cloud and it’s the same feature request for both. So I’ve found this support page being the more common to the situation, move it if needed. 

When using Jira and Confluence apps, you can subscribe to notifications for any changes or updates. That’s really great. If you’ve an iPad and an iPhone you get notifications on both. 

All of this is good. 

The issue is more when the notifications get read on one device, it does not remove the waiting one on other devices. Which is annoying. 

As a feature request I would like to see visible system notifications reflecting the actual unread notifications (this include as well the macOS Jira app).

It’s technically possible, that’s what Facebook is doing with the Messenger app for example.
fields.summary: Notifications management for iOS Jira and Confluence apps

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you have a Version Picker Custom Field when clicking on the Release it just edits it instead of sending you to the Release & their Issues, this on New Issue View
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Version Picker (single or multi version) Custom Field
 # Add a Release to that Field
 # Click on the Release name

h3. Expected Results

The Release name should work as a hyperlink to the Issues contained by the Release.
h3. Actual Results

Just edit the Custom Field
h3. Workaround

You can change to the Old Issue View to get the expected behavior.
fields.summary: Version Picker Custom Field on New Issue View link to Release is not working

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, we are utilizing feature gates to promote Premium features in our products.  Customers have provided feedback that they do not want to be made aware of Premium features and have no interest in upgrading.

Example:
 !Screenshot 2020-02-06 at 12.53.51.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
* Add an option to remove Premium feature gates from our products

h3. Why this is important
* Gives customers more control over the product user experience
* Product gates can be undesirable as it makes the product seem like a "demo" version or incomplete
* The Premium feature buttons should be removed if customers actively do not want to upgrade and utilize those features
 
h3. Workaround 
* No known workarounds
fields.summary: Add option to turn off feature gates for Premium features

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The documentation *[Site access settings improvements|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/site-access-settings-improvements-979412810.html]* contains some instructions to disable the option to anonymous users request site access, but these steps actually don't exist in the *Site Administration* session.
h3. Suggestion

Remove all the below piece of content from the *Access Requests* header:
{quote}To modify access request permissions:
# Go to your site's *Administration* at [admin.atlassian.com|http://admin.atlassian.com/]:
** _If you're an admin for one site_, you'll land on the *Users* page of your site.
** _If you're an admin for multiple sites or an organization admin_, click a site's name and URL to open the *Administration* for that site.
# Select *Site access > Access requests*.
# Choose from the following options:
** *All new users can request access.* Any user on any domain can request access.
** *Only new users from the following domains can request access.* Manually define which domains can request access.
** *New users can't request access.* Users who aren’t on your site can’t request access. Your existing site users can still request access for them.
# Click *Save changes.*
{quote}
fields.summary: "Site access settings improvements" documentation with steps that doesn't exist

fields.description:
I just learned that as a standard user we have a limit on how much storage can be used by our attachments, etc.

As a customer, it is crucial that I can view the amount of storage that we have used so I can budget, or see the impact we have.

As a customer I need to be able to gather a report, by myself about where the storage is being used (i.e. Jira numbers 123, 349 and 223 have 250MB). This then allows me to make a conscious decision about whether to delete the attachments, depending upon how old the Jira is, etc.)
fields.summary: Provide way to view cloud storage usage

fields.description: As part of the site rename process, customers would like to reserve the desired URL while the process is being planned. This would prevent from frustration while working on a rename that may no longer be eligible when everything is all set.
fields.summary: Ability to reserve a site name

fields.description:
I deed to see my own names of sites in product list. If i have two instances of Confluence i need to understand who is who.

Screenshot:  !https://i.imgur.com/EKBjiso.png!
fields.summary: Name of site in product list

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, in order to have JIRA and Confluence Cloud working as the expected (with all of its features), we need to let third-party cookies unblocked on our browsers. This is an insecure practice that is mandatory for a paid product that should work without this setting.

h3 Suggestion
* Change the way the products work in order to allow them to work without the need to allow third-party cookies in the browsers.
fields.summary: Change the way Atlassian Cloud products work with third-party cookies

fields.description:
As an example, when viewing an EPIC containing STORIES, those STORIES are listed. It may be handy to see if those STORIES have been placed into any SPRINTS (current, planned, multiple, or backlog) - \{if multiple, then space is an issue, however a pop-up on hover or drop-down may be a solution} - This could also possibly show inherited Sprint on SUB-TASKS of a STORY  if same is applied to STORIES and concept possibly extrapolated up the hierarchy to parents of epics and grandparents.  

I have mocked a pic to illustrate, however no function here to upload, so please contact me if you would like me to send it.

Thanks,

Kind Regards

Brendan.
fields.summary: Display issuetypes sprint/s in parent issuetype screen view

fields.description: I'm sure I'm like most people who have 100 Jira tabs open all the time.  It would be super handy to be able to see the issue type as an icon on the tab.  That way it would be easy to see which tabs are epics, stories, bugs, etc.  Hopefully this would be a simple change that would improve the UX 100x.
fields.summary: Change the browser icon based on the issue type

fields.description:
Currently, if a user wants to request assistance, the user must open the [support.atlassian.com|https://support.atlassian.com/] and find the option to raise a support request. There, the user will have to fill a form with a URL, email address, etc. 

Opening a Support Request through the instance's UI would make things easier since part of the information would be filled and the user wouldn't need to access a different page for that.
fields.summary: Ability to open tickets with Atlassian Support through Cloud instances

fields.description: We want to be able to add links to internal tickets in client-facing documentation without the status showing. This only seems to be possible in table view, not single issue view.
fields.summary: Hide Status on Jira LInk macro in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The admins should be able to cancel the pending user invitations in their site administration page. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access admin.atlassian.com;
# Try to cancel a pending user invite. 

h3. Expected Results
A "cancel invite" button should be available for admins to cancel the pending invitations
h3. Actual Results
There is no option to cancel the pending invites. 

h3. Workaround

A possible workaround is to delete the user from the user list. They should not be able to use the instance after this action.
fields.summary: Provide admins with the ability of cancelling a pending user invitation

fields.description:
{panel:title= Implementation of New Features Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
(i)
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features.
 You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].
{panel}
 

This ticket is derived from CLOUD-3635 to track customer requests for Cloud hosting in Tokyo region. Main objectives are:
 * To comply with industrial regulations of data locality
 * To improve product performance
fields.summary: Consider hosting services in Tokyo, Japan

fields.description:
Hi, we are thinking about moving from server to cloud but we 
really need to have a default comment security option available.  Are 
you planning on introducing an add on for
 that? 
We are not interested in using Service Desk as it's too restrictive for us.
fields.summary: Defoult comment security

fields.description: Once the page is loaded need to request for Option called check box
fields.summary: Need a checkbox on the summary page

fields.description: i would like to be able to create issues with attachments or to add attachments to existing issues
fields.summary: As a client, i would like to be able to add attachments to issues in JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
While inviting users, the option to allow users from a domain join the site is available. Checking this option, changes the site access setting to allow users from the domain join the site. 

h3. Suggestion
Adding an option to disable this functionality in order to prevent this setting to be changed by mistake.
fields.summary: Option to disable the "Any user from this domain can join"option

fields.description: At the moment, cloud products are billed / subscribed to separately. For easier management, it would be good to have a centralized billing system for the different products on cloud.
fields.summary: Provide a centralized billing system for all products in cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When deactivating a user on the User Management page, if the page is not fully loaded, when clicking to deactivate the user, the page will refresh and the user appears as active

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access the user on the User Management page
# With the page not fully loaded, click to remove Site Access
 [^Recording #37.mp4]  

h3. Expected Results
The user should be deactivated

h3. Actual Results
The page finishes the load the user appears as an active user. If you refresh the page, the user will be no longer active

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Deactivating a user without page fully loaded makes the user appears to be activated again

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Deactivate users in bulk based on last login date

h3. Suggested Solution
Deactivate users in bulk based on last login date

h3. Why this is important
The customer wants to deactivate users in bulk based on last login date
fields.summary: Deactivate users in bulk based on last login date

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Cannot set the expiry date for a user while creating

h3. Suggested Solution
Set expiry date for a user while creating

h3. Why this is important
The customer wants to Set expiry date for a user while creating
fields.summary: Set expiry date for a user while creating

fields.description:
Please enable 3rd party actions in Automation for Jira. The Better PDF Automation for Jira plugin does not have a Cloud counterpart due to this and this was an incredibly valuable plugin for many customers. 

!image-2019-12-05-07-46-13-843.png!
fields.summary: Allow third-party automation actions in Jira Cloud

fields.description:
In an issue's detailed view, when I click a link inside of Jira, it is opened in the same window instead of the issue, which I don't believe it's the user's intention.

I would suggest to open it in a new window tab by default.
fields.summary: Open links in a new window by default

fields.description:
Sometimes happens that a ticket is submitted to the wrong project or the same ticket should be resolved in different projects, so it would be great if you add a new field called projects with a dropdown list of all projects to the Jira tickets and allow to move tickets from the original project to other projects back and fort.

Thanks.

--Shahnaz Riahi
fields.summary: Alow send tickets to other projects

fields.description:
Now I know my company doesn't always allow all features but google also didn't have a response. 

Sometimes, something that hasn't happened is as important as something that did happen. I don't always need an email for everything that has changed. Sometimes I need to know who hasn't updated their materials on Confluence. The ability to set a recurring and/or specific date to look at "active" projects and make sure they have been updated or request an update if not.

Also if I could add a mention so that I can quietly ask the person to update the page automatically would be helpful.

 

In my mind it would be a macro and a selection or drop down allowing "notification" "every two weeks" "If not updated" 

Then when you see a page notification of something not updated a set list of mentions or people from your org that should own the update are in the corner with a request upodate button.
fields.summary: Notifications about something that wasn't updated

fields.description:
Currently, to see the option to delete users from Jira or Confluence sites is necessary to access the user details and from there it's possible to delete the user using the option *more(...) > Remove User*

To make it more user-friendly, it would be better to have the possibility to delete users from the users' list view in the user management screen.
fields.summary: Delete users from the User management view

fields.description:
As an admin I'd like a notification when the system is attempting to send email to blocked accounts.  I understand that blocking is necessary and needed.  But right now there is no indication that an account has been blocked.  The owner needs to recognize the lack of email and trigger an inquiry.  

We use Office365 for email; 7 (out of 90) accounts were blocked due to email being bounced.  I don't know if this was a single root cause or if Office365 is not reliable.  But the affected individuals were not heavy users and did not pick up on the lack of emails for  days or weeks.  This effectively breaks the trust we have with the user base.
fields.summary: Better visibility for accounts with blocked email

fields.description:
Is there a way, or are you developing a function in the cloud / server versions which will allow Site Admins to set a "No Activity" deactivation date for 90+ days "No Activity" - this would really help in managing users/licenses... Right now it's very manual intensive, when you have hundreds of users.. This is part of our compliance for all our systems/apps we use company-wide.

Thanks, Terri
fields.summary: System Function to setup Automatic deactivation for users w/90+ days no activity

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, administrators cannot see or change their ServerID themselves in their cloud instance
h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the option for administrators to see and change ServerID themselves within the cloud instance
h3. Why this is important
When cloning an instance, the ServerID of the old instance is cloned as well which causes issues with application links
fields.summary: Provide the option for administrators to see and change ServerID within the cloud instance

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Previously, it was possible to use cookie-based authentication and generate a cookie through the API to be used on the browser, as per [How to make use of a cookie to get logged through the browser?|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/how-to-make-use-of-a-cookie-to-get-logged-through-the-browser-945106839.html].
Although, according to that doc, this was deprecated.

h3. Suggested Solution
Bring back the {{/rest/auth/1/session}} endpoint or provide any other way to programatically generate cookies

h3. Workaround
No other workaround besides authenticating through the browser as usual
fields.summary: Bring cookie-based authentication back

fields.description:
